intro: Agalmyla borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has simple, opposite leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
